title: Pride Of Britain: EastEnders star Louisa Lytton dazzles in a feather-trimmed champagne silk gown
text:
She's enjoyed a career comeback since returning to her role as Ruby Allen in EastEnders last year after 12 years away from Albert Square.

And Louisa Lytton mingled with the great and good of the television industry as she attended the Pride Of Britain Awards at London's Grosvenor House Hotel on Monday.

The actress, 30, exuded glamour as she posed up a storm in a champagne coloured silk gown featuring an eye-catching dramatic feather trim.

Glamorous: Louisa Lytton mingled with the great and good of the television industry as she attended the Pride Of Britain Awards at London's Grosvenor House Hotel on Monday

The floor length dress showcased her slender frame before a ruched skirt flowed down to her feet and into a small train.

The soap star held a silver pouch bag by a short chain and wore nude sandals on her feet, while accessorising with silver earrings.

Louisa's hands were free from all jewellery to accentuate her glistening engagement ring, and she wore flattering make-up to highlight her delicate features.

The EastEnders star's appearance comes as she plans her 2021 wedding to fiancé Ben Bhanvra.

Elegant: The actress, 30, exuded glamour as she posed up a storm in a champagne coloured silk gown featuring an eye-catching dramatic feather trim

Co-stars: The floor length dress showcased her slender frame before a ruched skirt flowed down to her feet and into a small train as she posed with Rita Simons)

Ben proposed during a romantic getaway to the Maldives for Louisa's 30th birthday on May 6.

In an interview with OK! magazine, Ben - who moved in with Louisa just four months after they met - admitted the proposal didn’t quite go to plan.

Ben told the publication: 'I took Louisa to a quiet part of the island where I knew no one else would be around.

'I told her I wanted to fly my drone to get some aerial pictures of the island, although really I wanted it to capture a video of the moment I proposed.

Homeward bound: The soap star held a silver pouch bag by a short chain and wore nude sandals on her feet, while accessorising with silver earrings

'As soon as I got it up in the air and reached to get the ring from the bag a cleaner walked past and was so mesmerised by the drone he was just stood next to us staring at it for ages.'

Ben said he just got so frustrated that he grabbed the ring and got down on one knee as soon as the cleaner left.

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars came together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Accessories: Louisa's hands were free from all jewellery to accentuate her glistening engagement ring, and she wore flattering make-up to highlight her delicate features

Calling it a night: Louisa was a vision of composure as she made her way home from the bash

Hosted by Carol Vorderman, celebrities and public figures including Prince Charles, Robert Downey Jr, Sir Ben Kingsley, Dua Lipa, Ant & Dec, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Adam Lambert, Christine Lampard, Sir Michael Caine, Jonathan Ross, Suranne Jones, and the judges and casts of Strictly Come Dancing and X Factor will be honouring this year's awe-inspiring winners.

Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started.

'In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will be broadcast on ITV on November 5 at 8pm.
